descriptionText: The Brazilian Congress of Power Electronics (COBEP) is a biennial congress, sponsored by the Brazilian Society of Power Electronics (SOBRAEP). COBEP is the largest and most traditional scientific event in its area, in Brazil. It aims to bring together the entire Latin American community interested in areas related to Power Electronics. Its four most recent editions were held in the cities of Santos-SP (2019), Juiz de Fora-MG (2017), Fortaleza-CE (2015), Gramado-RS (2013). The XVI Brazilian Congress of Power Electronics (COBEP 2021) will be held in the city of João Pessoa, Paraíba, between November 7 and 10, 2021. The organization of the work is the responsibility of the Graduate Program in Electrical Engineering at the University Federal da Paraíba (UFPB), the Smart Grid Group (SG2) and the PES / IAS / PELS Nordeste 1 chapter of the IEEE. The city of João Pessoa is the capital of the state of Paraíba and has a privileged geographical location, equidistant from the main capitals of the Northeast region of Brazil. At the mouth of the Paraíba River, its old part is known for its baroque architecture and “art nouveau”. At sea level, the climate is pleasant (with an average temperature of 25.1 ° C in September, an average relative humidity of 77%), with a population of approximately 720 thousand inhabitants.
topicTitle: The main topics of interest include, but are not limited to:
topic2: Electrical machines, motor drives and speed control
topic3: Modeling, simulation and control in power electronics
topic4: Power quality, harmonics and reactive power compensation
topic6: Power electronics in renewable energy systems
topic7: Power electronics in smart grids and utility applications
topic8: Power semiconductor devices, packaging, magnetic materials and passive components
topic10: Automotive, aerospace and power electronics transport applications
topic11: Industrial, commercial and residential applications of power electronics
